news_summary: Significant progress in human rights includes enhanced online age verification in the UK and strengthened diplomatic efforts in the Sahel through an African Union special envoy appointment.
news_summary_fr: Parmi les progrès significatifs en matière de droits de l'homme, citons l'amélioration de la vérification de l'âge en ligne au Royaume-Uni et le renforcement des efforts diplomatiques au Sahel grâce à la nomination d'un envoyé spécial de l'Union africaine.
news_summary_es: Entre los avances significativos en materia de derechos humanos cabe destacar la mejora de la verificación de la edad en línea en el Reino Unido y el refuerzo de la labor diplomática en el Sahel mediante el nombramiento de un enviado especial de la Unión Africana.

articles.title: Around 6,000 porn sites start checking ages in UK
articles.summary: Despite the law some remain sceptical about the effectiveness of porn age checks.
articles.content:
Around 6,000 porn sites start checking ages in UK

17 hours ago Share Save Liv McMahon & Andrew Rogers BBC News Share Save

Getty Images

Around 6,000 sites allowing porn in the UK will start checking if users are over 18 on Friday, according to the media regulator Ofcom. Dame Melanie Dawes, its chief executive, told the BBC "we are starting to see not just words but action from the technology industry" to improve child safety online. She told BBC Radio Four's Today programme that "no other country had pulled off" such measures, nor gained commitments from so many platforms, including Elon Musk's X, around age verification. But the BBC understands at least one major porn site operating in the UK does not seem to be requiring age checks as of Friday morning.

And experts remain sceptical about the effectiveness of Ofcom's age checks and how easy it may be for people, particularly children, to circumvent them. Ofcom said on Thursday that more platforms, including Discord, X (formerly Twitter), social media app Bluesky and dating app Grindr, had agreed to bring in age checks. The regulator had already received commitments from sites such as Pornhub - the UK's most visited porn website - and social media platform Reddit. Requirements to verify age on Reddit appear to have taken effect across a wide range of its individual, topic-based subreddits, such as those dedicated to discussions about alcohol. The Technology Secretary Peter Kyle told BBC Newsbeat the UK's new rules apply "common sense" to regulating the internet. "We're very used to proving our age in lots of different areas of life at the moment, and it makes sense that we do so more assertively when it comes to online activity," he said. "I think people actually think it's pretty weird that you are age checked when you want to buy a can of Monster, but you're not age checked when you access certain material online."

Chris Sherwood, chief executive of children's charity the NSPCC, said Friday's new rules mean services "can no longer evade their duty for protecting children". He added it was "high time for tech companies to step up" and prevent children encountering harmful content on their platforms. "Children, and their parents, must not solely bear the responsibility of keeping themselves safe online," he said. For Prof Elena Martellozzo, professor of child sexual exploitation and abuse research at the University of Edinburgh, the rules send a message to the tech industry that "child safety and child protection are not optional". "Failing to act is no longer excusable under the guise of technical complexity or business models," she added.

'More to be done'
articles.reasoning: The implementation of age checks on around 6,000 porn sites in the UK represents a positive government policy aimed at protecting minors from inappropriate content online. Although there is some skepticism about effectiveness, the move shows progress in safeguarding children and promoting responsible internet use.
articles.personality_title: Thousands of UK porn sites begin checking users’ ages to protect kids
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
In the UK, there has been growing concern about children accessing adult pornographic websites online. Laws were introduced to require these sites to verify that users are over 18 years old before allowing access.

**What happened**
Starting this week, about 6,000 porn websites in the UK have begun checking the age of their visitors. This means users must prove they are adults before they can view explicit content. The media regulator Ofcom is leading this effort, encouraging technology companies to take real steps toward protecting children.

**Impact**
This new system helps keep minors away from inappropriate material by adding a safety check online. While some people are unsure how effective the age checks will be, this policy marks an important move toward safer internet use for young people.

**What's next step**
Officials and technology firms will continue to work together to improve these age verification tools. They aim to make the process smoother and harder to bypass, ensuring better protection for children in the future.

**One-sentence takeaway**
By requiring age checks on thousands of porn sites, the UK is taking a strong step to keep children safe from adult content online.
articles.personality_title_fr: Des milliers de sites pornographiques au Royaume-Uni vérifient désormais l’âge des utilisateurs pour protéger les enfants
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Au Royaume-Uni, l'accès des enfants à des sites pornographiques en ligne a suscité de vives inquiétudes. Des lois ont été mises en place pour obliger ces sites à vérifier que les utilisateurs ont plus de 18 ans avant d'autoriser l'accès.

**Ce qui s’est passé**
Depuis cette semaine, environ 6 000 sites pornographiques au Royaume-Uni ont commencé à vérifier l'âge de leurs visiteurs. Cela signifie que les utilisateurs doivent prouver qu'ils sont majeurs avant de pouvoir voir du contenu explicite. Le régulateur des médias Ofcom mène cette initiative, encourageant les entreprises technologiques à agir concrètement pour protéger les enfants.

**Impact**
Ce nouveau système aide à empêcher les mineurs d'accéder à des contenus inappropriés en ajoutant un contrôle de sécurité sur internet. Bien que certains doutent encore de l'efficacité de ces vérifications, cette politique représente un progrès important vers un usage plus sûr du web pour les jeunes.

**Prochaine étape**
Les autorités et les entreprises technologiques continueront à collaborer pour améliorer ces outils de vérification d'âge. L'objectif est de rendre le processus plus simple et plus difficile à contourner, assurant ainsi une meilleure protection des enfants à l'avenir.

**Phrase clé**
En imposant des contrôles d'âge sur des milliers de sites pornographiques, le Royaume-Uni fait un pas fort pour protéger les enfants des contenus pour adultes en ligne.
articles.personality_title_es: Miles de sitios pornográficos en el Reino Unido comienzan a verificar la edad de los usuarios para proteger a los niños
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
En el Reino Unido, ha habido preocupación creciente por el acceso de menores a sitios web pornográficos. Se implementaron leyes que requieren que estos sitios verifiquen que los usuarios tengan más de 18 años antes de permitir el acceso.

**Qué pasó**
Desde esta semana, alrededor de 6,000 sitios pornográficos en el Reino Unido han empezado a verificar la edad de sus visitantes. Esto significa que los usuarios deben demostrar que son adultos para ver contenido explícito. El regulador de medios Ofcom lidera esta iniciativa, motivando a las empresas tecnológicas a tomar acciones concretas para proteger a los niños.

**Impacto**
Este nuevo sistema ayuda a mantener a los menores alejados de material inapropiado al añadir un control de seguridad en línea. Aunque hay dudas sobre la efectividad, esta política es un avance importante hacia un uso más seguro de internet para los jóvenes.

**Próximo paso**
Funcionarios y empresas tecnológicas seguirán colaborando para mejorar estas herramientas de verificación de edad, buscando que el proceso sea más fácil y difícil de evadir para proteger mejor a los niños.

**Conclusión en una frase**
Al requerir controles de edad en miles de sitios pornográficos, el Reino Unido da un paso firme para proteger a los niños del contenido adulto en línea.
articles.image_prompt: A detailed, warm-toned painting of a sturdy, glowing digital gate guarded by friendly, abstract lock and key shapes, with softly illuminated icons of websites and social media platforms gently floating behind the gate, symbolizing age verification protecting a colorful, safe space where youthful silhouettes play peacefully beyond.

articles.title: Sahel Region: African Union Appoints Special Envoy
articles.summary:
Click to expand Image
          



  
        
  

        
                      
      
        
              Burundi's president Évariste Ndayishimiye at the European Union-Africa Union Summit in Brussels, Belgium, on Feb. 17, 2022.
                    © 2022 Valeria Mongelli/Bloomberg via Getty Images
          
    


  
(Nairobi) – The African Union’s (AU) appointment of Burundi’s president as its special envoy for the Sahel region strengthens the AU’s capacity to address the most pressing human rights challenges facing Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger, Human Rights Watch said today in a letter to President Evariste Ndayishimiye. The appointment of Ndayishimiye on July 17, 2025, comes at a critical juncture in the Sahel, marked by increased threats to civilians caught in armed conflict, emboldened authoritarianism of the military juntas, and growing marginalization of independent institutions, including the AU and the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS). These dynamics have eroded the rule of law, widened impunity for serious human rights abuses, and left civilians increasingly vulnerable.“Despite Burundi’s very troubling human rights record, President Ndayishimiye has an opportunity to promote human rights and rights-based governance in the Sahel,” said Allan Ngari, Africa advocacy director at Human Rights Watch. “A failure to do so would signal a dangerous tolerance for authoritarianism under the guise of diplomacy.” Ndayishimiye should make respect for human rights and the rule of law prominent in the AU’s approach to the Sahel and address the following major concerns:Islamist armed groups and government security forces continue to commit serious violations of international humanitarian law, including war crimes and possible crimes against humanity. As of mid-2025, the armed conflicts in the Sahel had killed at least tens of thousands of civilians, resulting in one of the world's most acute humanitarian crises, forcing over three million people from their homes. Since 2020, Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger have experienced military coups. The ruling military juntas have shown intolerance for political opposition and dissent. Civic and political space has shrunk as a crackdown on journalists, civil society activists, and opposition party members has increased, through arbitrary detention, enforced disappearances, and unlawful conscription.  The military leaders of the three countries have solidified their power without elections, delaying the return to democratic civilian rule. The authorities in Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger have ignored calls for accountability and failed to uphold their international legal obligations to investigate serious rights violations by their security forces, and hold those responsible accountable, allowing impunity to fester and emboldening the abusers. In 2025, the three countries officially left ECOWAS, depriving their citizens of the opportunity to seek justice for human rights violations through the ECOWAS Court of Justice.“The AU special envoy should open a meaningful dialogue with the authorities of Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger on their governments’ obligations to protect human rights,” Ngari said. “He should ensure that the AU’s strategy on the Sahel prioritizes the protection of civilians at risk, the need to respect civil and political rights, and the promotion of justice and accountability.”
articles.content:
Click to expand Image Burundi's president Évariste Ndayishimiye at the European Union-Africa Union Summit in Brussels, Belgium, on Feb. 17, 2022. © 2022 Valeria Mongelli/Bloomberg via Getty Images

(Nairobi) – The African Union’s (AU) appointment of Burundi’s president as its special envoy for the Sahel region strengthens the AU’s capacity to address the most pressing human rights challenges facing Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger, Human Rights Watch said today in a letter to President Evariste Ndayishimiye.

The appointment of Ndayishimiye on July 17, 2025, comes at a critical juncture in the Sahel, marked by increased threats to civilians caught in armed conflict, emboldened authoritarianism of the military juntas, and growing marginalization of independent institutions, including the AU and the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS). These dynamics have eroded the rule of law, widened impunity for serious human rights abuses, and left civilians increasingly vulnerable.

“Despite Burundi’s very troubling human rights record, President Ndayishimiye has an opportunity to promote human rights and rights-based governance in the Sahel,” said Allan Ngari, Africa advocacy director at Human Rights Watch. “A failure to do so would signal a dangerous tolerance for authoritarianism under the guise of diplomacy.”

Ndayishimiye should make respect for human rights and the rule of law prominent in the AU’s approach to the Sahel and address the following major concerns:

Islamist armed groups and government security forces continue to commit serious violations of international humanitarian law, including war crimes and possible crimes against humanity. As of mid-2025, the armed conflicts in the Sahel had killed at least tens of thousands of civilians, resulting in one of the world's most acute humanitarian crises, forcing over three million people from their homes.

Since 2020, Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger have experienced military coups. The ruling military juntas have shown intolerance for political opposition and dissent. Civic and political space has shrunk as a crackdown on journalists, civil society activists, and opposition party members has increased, through arbitrary detention, enforced disappearances, and unlawful conscription. The military leaders of the three countries have solidified their power without elections, delaying the return to democratic civilian rule.

The authorities in Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger have ignored calls for accountability and failed to uphold their international legal obligations to investigate serious rights violations by their security forces, and hold those responsible accountable, allowing impunity to fester and emboldening the abusers. In 2025, the three countries officially left ECOWAS, depriving their citizens of the opportunity to seek justice for human rights violations through the ECOWAS Court of Justice.

“The AU special envoy should open a meaningful dialogue with the authorities of Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger on their governments’ obligations to protect human rights,” Ngari said. “He should ensure that the AU’s strategy on the Sahel prioritizes the protection of civilians at risk, the need to respect civil and political rights, and the promotion of justice and accountability.”
articles.reasoning: The appointment of a special envoy by the African Union to address human rights challenges in the Sahel region represents a proactive diplomatic effort to improve the dire situation. While the context involves serious ongoing human rights abuses and conflict, the move signals hope for increased attention to human rights, rule of law, and civilian protection in a troubled region.
articles.personality_title: African Union appoints special envoy to boost human rights in Sahel
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
The Sahel region in Africa, including Mali, Burkina Faso, and Niger, faces serious challenges like armed conflict, military rule, and human rights abuses. Civilians are caught in dangerous situations, and democratic freedoms are shrinking.

**What happened**
The African Union appointed Burundi’s president, Évariste Ndayishimiye, as a special envoy to the Sahel. This role focuses on improving human rights and encouraging better governance in the region. Despite Burundi’s own challenges, Ndayishimiye has a chance to support peace and rule of law where it's urgently needed.

**Impact**
This appointment shows the African Union’s commitment to addressing the region’s struggles. The special envoy will work to protect civilians, promote justice, and ensure governments respect human rights. It’s a hopeful step toward reducing violence and supporting democratic principles.

**What's next step**
President Ndayishimiye will open talks with leaders in Mali, Burkina Faso, and Niger to push for human rights protection and accountability. The African Union aims to prioritize civilian safety and restore democratic rule, creating a roadmap for lasting peace.

**One-sentence takeaway**
The African Union’s special envoy appointment marks a hopeful move to strengthen human rights and peace in the Sahel region.
articles.personality_title_fr: L'Union africaine nomme un envoyé spécial pour renforcer les droits humains au Sahel
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
La région du Sahel en Afrique, comprenant le Mali, le Burkina Faso et le Niger, fait face à de graves défis comme les conflits armés, les régimes militaires et les violations des droits humains. Les civils sont en danger et les libertés démocratiques diminuent.

**Ce qui s'est passé**
L'Union africaine a nommé le président du Burundi, Évariste Ndayishimiye, envoyé spécial pour le Sahel. Ce rôle vise à améliorer les droits humains et encourager une meilleure gouvernance dans la région. Malgré les défis au Burundi, Ndayishimiye a l'opportunité de soutenir la paix et l'État de droit là où c'est urgent.

**Impact**
Cette nomination montre l'engagement de l'Union africaine à répondre aux problèmes de la région. L'envoyé spécial travaillera à protéger les civils, promouvoir la justice et garantir le respect des droits humains par les gouvernements. C'est un pas encourageant pour réduire la violence et soutenir les principes démocratiques.

**Prochaine étape**
Le président Ndayishimiye entamera des discussions avec les dirigeants du Mali, Burkina Faso et Niger pour promouvoir la protection des droits humains et la responsabilité. L'Union africaine souhaite prioriser la sécurité des civils et restaurer la démocratie, créant ainsi une feuille de route pour une paix durable.

**En résumé**
La nomination d'un envoyé spécial par l'Union africaine est un signe d'espoir pour renforcer les droits humains et la paix dans la région du Sahel.
articles.personality_title_es: La Unión Africana nombra un enviado especial para fortalecer los derechos humanos en el Sahel
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
La región del Sahel en África, que incluye Mali, Burkina Faso y Níger, enfrenta graves desafíos como conflictos armados, gobiernos militares y violaciones de derechos humanos. Los civiles están en peligro y las libertades democráticas están disminuyendo.

**Qué pasó**
La Unión Africana nombró al presidente de Burundi, Évariste Ndayishimiye, como enviado especial para el Sahel. Este papel se enfoca en mejorar los derechos humanos y fomentar una mejor gobernanza en la región. A pesar de los propios desafíos de Burundi, Ndayishimiye tiene la oportunidad de apoyar la paz y el estado de derecho donde más se necesita.

**Impacto**
Esta designación muestra el compromiso de la Unión Africana de abordar los problemas de la región. El enviado especial trabajará para proteger a los civiles, promover la justicia y asegurar que los gobiernos respeten los derechos humanos. Es un paso esperanzador para reducir la violencia y apoyar los principios democráticos.

**Próximo paso**
El presidente Ndayishimiye abrirá diálogos con los líderes de Mali, Burkina Faso y Níger para impulsar la protección de los derechos humanos y la rendición de cuentas. La Unión Africana busca priorizar la seguridad de los civiles y restaurar el gobierno democrático, creando una hoja de ruta para una paz duradera.

**Conclusión en una frase**
El nombramiento del enviado especial de la Unión Africana marca un paso esperanzador para fortalecer los derechos humanos y la paz en la región del Sahel.
articles.image_prompt: A detailed, warm painting of a sturdy baobab tree with its branches gently intertwining three glowing lanterns, each lantern symbolizing Mali, Burkina Faso, and Niger, set against a soft sunset sky over the Sahel’s arid landscape, with a peaceful river flowing nearby representing hope, unity, and human rights restoration.
